intro: Phytolacca mexicana, commonly known as Mexican pokeweed, is a shrub-like plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It features thick, fleshy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into dark purple berries, which are toxic to humans and livestock.
